intro: Meniocus linifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf meniocus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, this species thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
